definition: to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Remember repeat business is why you are in business.
sentences.chinese: 記得你是舊地重遊，所以生意。

sentences.english: Go, let the old ground with me once.
sentences.chinese: 走吧，陪我舊地重遊一次吧。

sentences.english: One day at a certain time, to return.
Here we are again, Its like a dream, but this is real to me (yeah)
sentences.chinese: 現在咱們舊地重遊，如夢一場，但這都是真的。

definition: When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
to make a concession/to be accommodating
to heave a sigh of relief
to swallow clouds and blow out fog (idiom)/to blow cigarette or opium smoke
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
